intro: Galium granulatum, commonly known as the granulate bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers in clusters, typically blooming from June to August. Its leaves are usually covered with fine, granular hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. Galium granulatum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
